湧水: (ゆうすい) - spring; welling of water
湧泉: (ゆうせん) - bubbling spring; gushing spring; fountain
湮滅: (えんめつ) - {law} destruction (esp. of evidence)/spoliation/suppression; hiding/concealment
湯: (yu) - () - água quente, água quente; banho quente, fonte termal; ferro fundido
湯あか: (ゆあか) - scale (i.e. hard water coating in a kettle, etc.); fur
湯あがり: (ゆあがり) - after a bath/after taking a bath; large towel used after taking a bath/yukata worn after taking a bath
湯あたり: (ゆあたり) - dizziness caused by prolonged hot bath
湯くみ: (ゆくみ) - drawing hot water/person who draws hot water; employee who pours clean hot water used for rinsing in a bathhouse; ladle (esp. used in bath houses)
湯でる: (うでる) - to boil (something in hot water); to treat with medicinal steam (a swelling, etc.)
湯で麺器: (ゆでめんき) - noodle boiler; noodle boiling machine
湯で麺機: (ゆでめんき) - noodle boiler; noodle boiling machine
湯の盤銘: (とうのばんめい) - inscription on the bathtub of King Tang ("If you can renovate yourself one day, then you can do so every day, and keep doing so day after day.")
湯の花: (ゆのはな) - hot-springs mineral deposits (resembling flowers); flowers of sulphur; geyserite
湯の華: (ゆのはな) - hot-springs mineral deposits (resembling flowers); flowers of sulphur; geyserite
湯ぶね: (ゆぶね) - bathtub; boat with a bathtub rented to customers (Edo period)
湯をわかす: (ゆをわかす) - to boil water; to get the bath ready
湯を使う: (ゆをつかう) - to take a hot bath
湯を沸かして水にする: (ゆをわかしてみずにする) - wasting one's efforts; rendering one's efforts futile
湯を沸す: (ゆをわかす) - to boil water; to get the bath ready
湯上がり: (ゆあがり) - after a bath/after taking a bath; large towel used after taking a bath/yukata worn after taking a bath
湯上り: (ゆあがり) - after a bath/after taking a bath; large towel used after taking a bath/yukata worn after taking a bath
湯中り: (ゆあたり) - dizziness caused by prolonged hot bath
湯元: (ゆもと) - source of a hot spring
湯具: (ゆぐ) - accessories used for bathing; garment used while bathing
湯冷まし: (ゆざまし) - boiled water which has cooled
湯冷め: (ゆざめ) - feeling chilly after taking a bath
湯切り: (ゆぎり) - draining hot water (e.g. from noodles)
湯取: (ゆとり) - clothing to absorb dampness after bathing/yukata; twice-boiled rice (for sick persons); scoop for removing bilge water
湯取り: (ゆとり) - clothing to absorb dampness after bathing/yukata; twice-boiled rice (for sick persons); scoop for removing bilge water
湯取り飯: (ゆとりめし) - twice-boiled rice (for sick persons)
湯垢: (ゆあか) - scale (i.e. hard water coating in a kettle, etc.); fur
湯女: (ゆな) - women who assist bathers at hot-springs resorts; bathhouse prostitute
湯女風呂: (ゆなぶろ) - bathhouse used for prostitution (Edo period)
湯室: (ゆむろ) - room for boiling water; bathroom/bath
湯屋: (ゆや) - public bathhouse; building with a bath (esp. in a shrine or temple)
湯巻き: (ゆまき) - women's waistcloth/loincloth; garment worn by nobles when bathing
湯帷子: (ゆかたびら) - single-layer absorbent bathrobe (worn during or after a bath)
湯当たり: (ゆあたり) - dizziness caused by prolonged hot bath
湯文字: (いもじ) - woman's loincloth (worn as a kimono underskirt); single-layer absorbent bathrobe (worn during or after a bath)
湯桶: (ゆとう) - pail-like wooden container typically lacquered in Japanese style, used for holding and serving hot liquids
湯槽: (ゆぶね) - bathtub; boat with a bathtub rented to customers (Edo period)
湯殿: (ゆどの) - bathroom; bathing; bathing attendant (for a noble)
湯気を立てて怒る: (ゆげをたてておこる) - to boil with rage; to seethe; to be furious; to fume with anger; to blow one's top
湯水: (ゆみず) - hot and cold water; abundant item/plentiful item
湯水のごとく: (ゆみずのごとく) - (as in 'spend money like water')  like water; like it grows on trees
湯水のように使う: (ゆみずのようにつかう) - to spend (money) like water; to spend (money) like it grows on trees; to throw around (one's money); to play ducks and drakes with
湯水の如く: (ゆみずのごとく) - (as in 'spend money like water')  like water; like it grows on trees
湯汲み: (ゆくみ) - drawing hot water/person who draws hot water; employee who pours clean hot water used for rinsing in a bathhouse; ladle (esp. used in bath houses)
湯治: (とうじ) - hot-spring cure; taking the baths
湯波: (ゆば) - tofu skin; dried beancurd; delicacy made from the skin of gently boiled soybean milk
湯浴み: (ゆあみ) - (taking a) bath; hot spring cure
湯潅: (ゆかん) - washing a corpse for burial
湯灌: (ゆかん) - washing a corpse for burial
湯煎: (ゆせん) - warming something by immersion in hot water
湯畑: (ゆばたけ) - hot spring area where mineral deposits are harvested
湯番: (ゆばん) - person at a public bath in charge of heating the water and filling the baths
湯疲れ: (ゆづかれ) - weariness caused by prolonged hot bath
湯立ち: (ゆだち) - Shinto ritual in which a shaman or priest soaks bamboo grass in boiling water and sprinkles the water on worshippers (originally a form of divination, later a purification ceremony, now primarily used to pray for good health)
湯立て: (ゆだて) - Shinto ritual in which a shaman or priest soaks bamboo grass in boiling water and sprinkles the water on worshippers (originally a form of divination, later a purification ceremony, now primarily used to pray for good health)
湯舟: (ゆぶね) - bathtub; boat with a bathtub rented to customers (Edo period)
湯船: (yubune) - bathtub; boat with a bathtub rented to customers (Período Edo)
湯花: (ゆばな) - hot-springs mineral deposits (resembling flowers); flowers of sulphur; geyserite
湯華: (ゆばな) - hot-springs mineral deposits (resembling flowers); flowers of sulphur; geyserite
湯葉: (ゆば) - tofu skin; dried beancurd; delicacy made from the skin of gently boiled soybean milk
湯通し: (ゆどおし) - soaking fabric in lukewarm water (to soften and remove starch)/desizing/moistening with steam; blanching (food)/parboiling food
湯量: (ゆりょう) - quantity of hot spring water
湯風呂: (ゆぶろ) - steam bath; hot water bath
